dialogues.text: Hey there, pup! Name's Maurice. I deliver mail rain or shine... though lately I've been dodging raccoons more than raindrops!
Trouble? They've knocked over three mailboxes this week! Mrs. Henderson hasn't gotten her knitting magazine in days. The whole neighborhood is on edge.
Well, there's been a surge of 'anonymous' letters warning about some sort of underground raccoon operation. Sounds crazy, right?
You've seen them too, huh? I knew it! Something big is going on beneath our feet. The sewers... I've heard noises coming from down there.
Ha! I wish it were a prank. But I've seen things on my route... strange shadows, overturned garbage, glowing eyes in the dark alleys.
Actually, yeah. My bait box slid down the manhole by the alley. If you spot it in the sewers, could you bring it back?
Listen, if you're the one patrolling this neighborhood, maybe you could help me out sometime? I've got deliveries that need safe passage!
Great! You're a real pal, Momi. I'll have something for you next time we meet. Stay safe out there!
No worries! You know where to find me. I'm always on this route, rain or shine... or raccoons.
Momi! Good to see you. The mail's been flowing better since you started patrolling. Fewer raccoon ambushes on my route!
Word on the street is those crows in the backyard answer to someone bigger. And the rats in the sewers? Organized. Someone's pulling the strings.
You too, pal! The neighborhood's counting on you!
